text: You are doing something incredibly hard, and you are doing it with love. That counts for everything.
author: Unknown

text: Rest is not giving up. Rest is how you keep going.
author: Unknown

text: You don't have to be perfect to be exactly what they need.
author: Unknown

text: Some days the bravest thing you can do is simply show up.
author: Unknown

text: Caring for someone is not a weakness. It is the quiet courage most people never have to find.
author: Unknown

text: You are allowed to feel tired and grateful at the same time.
author: Unknown

text: The world may not see what you do every day, but it matters more than you know.
author: Unknown

text: Grief and love can live in the same room. You don't have to choose between them.
author: Unknown

text: You cannot pour from an empty cup. Take care of yourself first.
author: Unknown

text: It is okay to ask for help. It does not mean you have failed.
author: Unknown

text: There is no right way to feel right now. Whatever you are feeling is valid.
author: Unknown

text: Breathe. You have survived every difficult day so far, and you will survive this one too.
author: Unknown

text: Your presence is the greatest gift you can give someone. Just being there is enough.
author: Unknown

text: Kindness is a language which the deaf can hear and the blind can see.
author: Mark Twain

text: You are not alone in this, even when it feels that way at three in the morning.
author: Unknown

text: Small moments of peace are not small. They are everything.
author: Unknown

text: Today you are enough. Tomorrow you will be enough. You have always been enough.
author: Unknown

text: Hope is being able to see that there is light despite all of the darkness.
author: Desmond Tutu

text: You are doing the work that holds the world together, one quiet act at a time.
author: Unknown

text: The strongest people are not those who show strength in front of us, but those who fight battles we know nothing about.
author: Unknown

text: Let yourself feel the tiredness. Then let yourself rest. Both are honest.
author: Unknown

text: No one is useless in this world who lightens the burdens of another.
author: Charles Dickens

text: A moment of self-compassion can change your entire day.
author: Unknown

text: Courage does not always roar. Sometimes courage is the quiet voice at the end of the day saying, I will try again tomorrow.
author: Mary Anne Radmacher

text: You are braver than you believe, stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think.
author: A.A. Milne

text: The dishes can wait. The laundry can wait. Your peace of mind cannot.
author: Unknown

text: Not every day will be good, but there is something good in every day.
author: Unknown

text: When you feel like giving up, remember why you held on for so long.
author: Unknown

text: It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light.
author: Aristotle

text: Crying does not mean you are weak. It means you have been strong for too long.
author: Unknown

text: The best thing to hold onto in life is each other.
author: Audrey Hepburn

text: You do not have to carry everything at once. Put something down. It will still be there when you are ready.
author: Unknown

text: Even the smallest act of caring can turn a life around.
author: Unknown

text: Your feelings are not a burden. They are the proof that you care deeply.
author: Unknown

text: Peace does not mean to be in a place where there is no noise or trouble. It means to be in the midst of those things and still be calm in your heart.
author: Unknown

text: You are someone's safe place. Never underestimate how much that means.
author: Unknown

text: It takes strength to be gentle.
author: Unknown

text: The greatest healing therapy is friendship and love.
author: Hubert H. Humphrey

text: One day at a time. One hour at a time. One breath at a time. That is enough.
author: Unknown

text: Almost everything will work again if you unplug it for a few minutes. Including you.
author: Anne Lamott

text: Difficult roads often lead to beautiful destinations.
author: Unknown

text: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: The love you give never disappears. It echoes in ways you may never see.
author: Unknown

text: You have been assigned this mountain to show others it can be moved.
author: Unknown

text: Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage.
author: Lao Tzu

text: The most important thing in illness is never to lose heart.
author: Nikolai Lenin

text: There is a crack in everything. That is how the light gets in.
author: Leonard Cohen

text: You are not failing. You are learning what works under impossible circumstances.
author: Unknown

text: The quietest acts of love are often the ones that matter the most.
author: Unknown

text: Give yourself the same compassion you so freely give to others.
author: Unknown

text: In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity.
author: Albert Einstein

text: You have already proven your strength a thousand times over. You just do not keep score.
author: Unknown

text: Nothing is permanent in this wicked world, not even our troubles.
author: Charlie Chaplin

text: Take a deep breath. This moment will pass, and you will still be standing.
author: Unknown

text: There are far, far better things ahead than any we leave behind.
author: C.S. Lewis

text: A kind word can warm three winter months.
author: Japanese Proverb

text: You deserve the love you keep giving to everyone else.
author: Unknown

text: Caring about someone is a radical act of love in a world that often forgets to slow down.
author: Unknown

text: The human spirit is stronger than anything that can happen to it.
author: C.C. Scott

text: When the world feels heavy, remember that you do not have to carry it alone.
author: Unknown

text: Sometimes the most productive thing you can do is rest.
author: Unknown

text: Love recognises no barriers.
author: Maya Angelou

text: Every day may not be good, but there is a little good in every day.
author: Unknown

text: The wound is the place where the light enters you.
author: Rumi

text: If you are tired, learn to rest, not to quit.
author: Banksy

text: What you do makes a difference, and you have to decide what kind of difference you want to make.
author: Jane Goodall

text: Guilt is the tax carers pay for loving someone so much. But you do not owe that tax.
author: Unknown

text: The only way through is through, and you are further along than you think.
author: Unknown

text: Let your rest be as deep as your tiredness.
author: Unknown

text: Those who bring sunshine into the lives of others cannot keep it from themselves.
author: J.M. Barrie

text: It is not the load that breaks you down. It is the way you carry it.
author: Lou Holtz

text: You were given this life because you are strong enough to live it.
author: Unknown

text: The simple act of paying attention can take you a long way.
author: Keanu Reeves

text: Wherever there is a human being, there is an opportunity for kindness.
author: Seneca

text: Frustration is not a sign that you are doing it wrong. It is a sign that you are doing something very hard.
author: Unknown

text: Stars cannot shine without darkness.
author: Unknown

text: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched. They must be felt with the heart.
author: Helen Keller

text: Be gentle with yourself. You are a child of the universe, no less than the trees and the stars.
author: Max Ehrmann

text: Your tiredness is earned. It is the weight of love made visible.
author: Unknown

text: We rise by lifting others.
author: Robert Ingersoll

text: The cup of tea you make for yourself is just as important as the one you make for them.
author: Unknown

text: Keep your face always toward the sunshine, and shadows will fall behind you.
author: Walt Whitman

text: What matters most is how well you walk through the fire.
author: Charles Bukowski

text: You are not what happened to you. You are what you choose to become.
author: Carl Jung

text: Caregiving often calls us to lean into love we did not know was possible.
author: Tia Walker

text: Even on the hardest days, you are making someone feel safe. That is extraordinary.
author: Unknown

text: Do not judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

text: The person who moves a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.
author: Confucius

text: Tenderness and kindness are not signs of weakness and despair, but manifestations of strength and resolution.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: It is okay to not be okay. It is okay to say so. It is okay to ask for help.
author: Unknown

text: In a world where you can be anything, be kind.
author: Unknown

text: Sometimes sitting with someone in silence is the loudest act of love.
author: Unknown

text: You do not need to see the whole staircase. Just take the first step.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: Your value is not measured by your productivity. You matter simply because you exist.
author: Unknown

text: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
author: William James

text: The best time for new beginnings is now.
author: Unknown

text: Sometimes the bravest and most important thing you can do is just show up.
author: Brene Brown

text: Resentment does not make you a bad carer. It makes you a human one.
author: Unknown

text: This too shall pass.
author: Persian Proverb

text: Where there is love, there is life.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Your body is telling you something when it aches. Listen to it with the same care you give others.
author: Unknown

text: The only impossible journey is the one you never begin.
author: Tony Robbins

text: You are the calm in someone else's storm. Do not forget to find your own shelter.
author: Unknown

text: Happiness can be found even in the darkest of times, if one only remembers to turn on the light.
author: J.K. Rowling

text: Every morning we are born again. What we do today matters most.
author: Buddha

text: You are not behind. You are not broken. You are right where you need to be.
author: Unknown

text: Let go of who you think you are supposed to be and embrace who you are.
author: Brene Brown

text: The fact that you worry about being a good carer means you already are one.
author: Unknown

text: We do not have to do all of it alone. We were never meant to.
author: Brene Brown

text: Five minutes of peace is not a luxury. It is a necessity.
author: Unknown

text: Life is not measured by the number of breaths we take, but by the moments that take our breath away.
author: Unknown

text: Out of difficulties grow miracles.
author: Jean de La Bruyere

text: It is not how much we do, but how much love we put into what we do.
author: Mother Teresa

text: You have been through a lot, and you are still here. That is strength.
author: Unknown

text: To care for those who once cared for us is one of the highest honours.
author: Tia Walker

text: Do what you can, with what you have, where you are.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: You are not selfish for wanting time to yourself. You are human.
author: Unknown

text: Anger does not make you ungrateful. It makes you honest about what this costs.
author: Unknown

text: The sun himself is weak when he first rises, and gathers strength and courage as the day goes on.
author: Charles Dickens

text: When we give cheerfully and accept gratefully, everyone is blessed.
author: Maya Angelou

text: Silence is sometimes the best answer.
author: Dalai Lama

text: Grief is the last act of love we have to give to those we loved. Where there is deep grief, there was great love.
author: Unknown

text: The art of life is a constant readjustment to our surroundings.
author: Kakuzo Okakura

text: Promise me you will not spend so much time treading water that you forget how much you enjoy swimming.
author: Unknown

text: There is no exercise better for the heart than reaching down and lifting people up.
author: John Holmes

text: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
author: Mark Twain

text: You do not always need a plan. Sometimes you just need to breathe, trust, let go, and see what happens.
author: Mandy Hale

text: The most wasted of all days is one without laughter.
author: E.E. Cummings

text: Nobody trips over mountains. It is the small pebble that causes you to stumble. Pass all the pebbles in your path and you will find you have crossed the mountain.
author: Unknown

text: There is nothing stronger than a broken person who has rebuilt themselves.
author: Unknown

text: You are allowed to scream. You are allowed to cry. Just do not give up.
author: Unknown

text: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: Slow down. Calm down. Do not worry. Do not hurry. Trust the process.
author: Alexandra Stoddard

text: Sometimes good things fall apart so better things can fall together.
author: Marilyn Monroe

text: The routine tasks you do with love are not routine at all. They are rituals of devotion.
author: Unknown

text: You can be both a masterpiece and a work in progress simultaneously.
author: Sophia Bush

text: Set peace of mind as your highest goal, and organise your life around it.
author: Brian Tracy

text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Your imperfect care is infinitely better than your absent care.
author: Unknown

text: When you cannot find the sunshine, be the sunshine.
author: Unknown

text: Some people arrive and make such a beautiful impact on your life, you can barely remember what life was like without them.
author: Anna Taylor

text: The most beautiful people we have known are those who have known suffering and have found their way out of the depths.
author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

text: Not all storms come to disrupt your life. Some come to clear your path.
author: Unknown

text: Loneliness in caring is real. You are seen, even when it does not feel like it.
author: Unknown

text: The measure of love is to love without measure.
author: St. Augustine

text: Within you there is a stillness and a sanctuary to which you can retreat at any time.
author: Hermann Hesse

text: Just when the caterpillar thought the world was over, it became a butterfly.
author: Chuang Tzu

text: Nobody cares how much you know until they know how much you care.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: You can cut all the flowers, but you cannot keep spring from coming.
author: Pablo Neruda

text: One kind word can change someone's entire day.
author: Unknown

text: The best view comes after the hardest climb.
author: Unknown

text: Missing the person they used to be while caring for the person they are now is one of the heaviest things a heart can hold.
author: Unknown

text: Patience is not the ability to wait, but the ability to keep a good attitude while waiting.
author: Joyce Meyer

text: How wonderful it is that nobody need wait a single moment before starting to improve the world.
author: Anne Frank

text: When you take care of yourself, you are also taking care of everyone who depends on you.
author: Unknown

text: Feelings come and go like clouds in a windy sky. Conscious breathing is my anchor.
author: Thich Nhat Hanh

text: Sometimes the strongest thing you can do is let someone else be strong for you.
author: Unknown

text: The pain you feel today is the strength you feel tomorrow.
author: Unknown

text: Love is not what the mind thinks, but what the heart feels.
author: Greg Evans

text: Caring for an ageing parent is an honour, not a burden. But it is also okay to say it is hard.
author: Unknown

text: The meaning of life is to find your gift. The purpose of life is to give it away.
author: Pablo Picasso

text: Walk as if you are kissing the earth with your feet.
author: Thich Nhat Hanh

text: The only thing that overcomes hard luck is hard work.
author: Harry Golden

text: Life is a balance between holding on and letting go.
author: Rumi

text: You are worth the quiet moment. You are worth the deeper breath. You are worth the time it takes to slow down.
author: Morgan Harper Nichols

text: Worrying does not take away tomorrow's troubles. It takes away today's peace.
author: Unknown

text: You already carry so much. Please do not carry guilt for being tired.
author: Unknown

text: The flower that blooms in adversity is the most rare and beautiful of all.
author: Mulan

text: Spread love everywhere you go. Let no one ever come to you without leaving happier.
author: Mother Teresa

text: Stop the glorification of busy. Rest. Recover. Be still.
author: Unknown

text: The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed people can change the world.
author: Margaret Mead

text: You have survived one hundred percent of your worst days. You are doing better than you think.
author: Unknown

text: Today was hard. But you showed up anyway. That is the whole story.
author: Unknown

text: Be patient with yourself. Self-growth is tender. It is holy ground.
author: Stephen Covey

text: A gentle answer turns away wrath.
author: Proverbs 15:1

text: Everything you have ever wanted is on the other side of fear.
author: George Addair

text: What we achieve inwardly will change outer reality.
author: Plutarch

text: It always seems impossible until it is done.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: The afternoon nap while they nap is not laziness. It is survival. And it is wise.
author: Unknown

text: We must accept finite disappointment, but never lose infinite hope.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: Your life will not always look like this. Seasons change, and so will this one.
author: Unknown

text: Inhale courage, exhale fear.
author: Unknown

text: If we have no peace, it is because we have forgotten that we belong to each other.
author: Mother Teresa

text: The hardest thing about caring is that nobody really understands until they have done it themselves.
author: Unknown

text: Real strength is not about how much you can handle before you break. It is about how much you can handle after you break.
author: Unknown

text: Calm mind brings inner strength and self-confidence, so that is very important for good health.
author: Dalai Lama

text: A day without laughter is a day wasted. Even a tired laugh counts.
author: Charlie Chaplin

text: Never give up, for that is just the place and time that the tide will turn.
author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

text: You do not find the happy life. You make it. One small moment at a time.
author: Camilla Eyring Kimball

text: Nothing is softer or more flexible than water, yet nothing can resist it.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Where there is great love, there are always miracles.
author: Willa Cather

text: When I loved myself enough, I began leaving whatever was not healthy. This meant people, jobs, my own beliefs, and habits. Anything that kept me small.
author: Kim McMillen

text: The wish for healing has always been half of health.
author: Seneca

text: Saying no to one thing means saying yes to something else. Sometimes that something else is you.
author: Unknown

text: The purpose of life is not to be happy. It is to be useful, to be honourable, to be compassionate.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: You may not control all the events that happen to you, but you can decide not to be reduced by them.
author: Maya Angelou

text: Sometimes the most helpful thing you can do is step outside and feel the air on your face.
author: Unknown

text: We are all a little broken. But last time I checked, broken crayons still colour.
author: Trent Shelton

text: In three words I can sum up everything I have learned about life: it goes on.
author: Robert Frost

text: The days are long, but the love is longer.
author: Unknown

text: Letting someone help you is not giving up. It is growing up.
author: Unknown

text: You have not lost yourself. You are just buried under everything you carry for others. You are still in there.
author: Unknown

text: Between stimulus and response there is a space. In that space is our power to choose our response.
author: Viktor Frankl

text: The most common way people give up their power is by thinking they do not have any.
author: Alice Walker

text: You have more influence by the quiet way you live than you will ever know.
author: Unknown

text: Being a full-time carer does not mean you are nothing else. You are still you.
author: Unknown

text: On the other side of this exhaustion, there is still you. Whole and worthy.
author: Unknown

text: Healing takes courage, and we all have courage, even if we have to dig a little to find it.
author: Tori Amos

text: They may not remember what you did. But they always remember how you made them feel.
author: Maya Angelou

text: Sometimes the kindest thing you can do for someone you love is take proper care of yourself.
author: Unknown

text: If you cannot do great things, do small things in a great way.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: It is perfectly okay to admit you are not okay and still keep going.
author: Unknown

text: You have been criticising yourself for years and it has not worked. Try approving of yourself and see what happens.
author: Louise Hay

text: The night is darkest just before the dawn. And the dawn is coming.
author: Unknown

text: One day someone will hug you so tight that all your broken pieces will fit back together.
author: Unknown

text: Your task is not to seek for love, but merely to seek and find all the barriers within yourself that you have built against it.
author: Rumi

text: Worn out is not a personality flaw. It is a natural response to an extraordinary situation.
author: Unknown

text: Each new day is a chance to begin again. Do not focus on the failures of yesterday.
author: Unknown

text: You are making a difference, even on the days when it feels like you are just getting through.
author: Unknown
